### Task 2: Figure S5a: Rare Viral Taxa (Family Level Bubble Plot)

```{r}
#| label: figs5a-bubble
#| message: true
#| fig.width: 8.5
#| fig.height: 6

message("========================================================================")
message("Figure S5a: Rare Viral Taxa Bubble Plot (Family Level)")
message("Criterion: Relative Abundance < 0.1% per sample group")
message("========================================================================\n")

# ============================================================================
# STEP 1: Extract data from TSE
# ============================================================================
message("üìä Extracting data from TSE...")

# Extract TPM assay
tpm_mat <- assays(tse)$tpm

# Extract family from rowData
family_df <- data.frame(
  vOTU_id = rownames(tse),
  family = as.character(rowData(tse)$family),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)

# Extract sample_group from colData
sample_df <- data.frame(
  sample_id = colnames(tse),
  sample_source1 = as.character(colData(tse)$sample_group),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)

message("‚úÖ Data extracted from TSE")
cat("Samples:", nrow(sample_df), "\n")
cat("Sample groups:", paste(unique(sample_df$sample_source1), collapse = ", "), "\n\n")

# ============================================================================
# STEP 2: Identify RARE vOTUs (< 0.1% and > 0, per sample_group)
# ============================================================================
message("üîç Calculating relative abundance (per sample_group)...")

# Convert to long format
abundance_long <- as.data.frame(tpm_mat) %>%
  rownames_to_column("vOTU_id") %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = -vOTU_id, names_to = "sample_id", values_to = "tpm") %>%
  dplyr::left_join(sample_df, by = "sample_id") %>%
  dplyr::left_join(family_df, by = "vOTU_id")

# Clean family names
abundance_long <- abundance_long %>%
  mutate(
    family = str_remove(family, regex("^(\\[?Family\\]?_?|f__|family_)", ignore_case = TRUE)),
    family = str_trim(family),
    family = ifelse(is.na(family) | family == "", "Unclassified virus", family)
  )

# Calculate total TPM per sample_group
sample_totals <- abundance_long %>%
  group_by(sample_source1) %>%
  summarise(total_TPM = sum(tpm, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")

# Calculate relative abundance (decimal: 0-1)
abundance_rel <- abundance_long %>%
  dplyr::left_join(sample_totals, by = "sample_source1") %>%
  mutate(rel_abundance = tpm / total_TPM)

# *** Identify RARE vOTUs (< 0.1% = < 0.001 AND > 0 per sample_group) ***
rare_vOTUs <- abundance_rel %>%
  filter(rel_abundance < 0.001 & rel_abundance > 0) %>%
  select(sample_source1, vOTU_id, family, rel_abundance) %>%
  arrange(sample_source1, desc(rel_abundance))

message(sprintf("‚úÖ Identified %d rare vOTU-sample pairs\n", nrow(rare_vOTUs)))

# ============================================================================
# STEP 3: Prepare plot data
# ============================================================================
message("üìä Preparing plot data...")

# Sum abundance per family per sample_group
df_sum <- rare_vOTUs %>%
  group_by(family, sample_source1) %>%
  summarise(total_abund = sum(rel_abundance), .groups = "drop")

# Keep top 14 families
top_families <- df_sum %>%
  group_by(family) %>%
  summarise(mean_abund = mean(total_abund), .groups = "drop") %>%
  arrange(desc(mean_abund)) %>%
  slice_head(n = 14) %>%
  pull(family)

df_sum <- df_sum %>%
  filter(family %in% top_families) %>%
  mutate(
    sample_source1 = factor(sample_source1, levels = c("BS", "SA", "IA", "DA")),
    family = fct_relevel(family, "Unclassified virus", after = 0)
  )

message("‚úÖ Plot data ready\n")

# ============================================================================
# STEP 4: Create bubble plot
# ============================================================================
message("üé® Creating bubble plot...")

p_bubble <- ggplot(df_sum, aes(x = total_abund, y = fct_rev(factor(family)), color = sample_source1)) +
  geom_point(aes(size = total_abund), alpha = 0.85) +
  scale_size_continuous(
    range = c(2, 10),
    name = "Relative Abundance",
    breaks = pretty(df_sum$total_abund, n = 4)
  ) +
  scale_x_continuous(
    breaks = seq(0, 0.8, by = 0.2),
    limits = c(0, max(df_sum$total_abund) * 1.1),
    labels = number_format(accuracy = 0.1)
  ) +
  scale_color_manual(
    values = c("BS" = "#E69F00", "SA" = "#56B4E9", "IA" = "#009E73", "DA" = "#F0E442"),
    name = "Sample"
  ) +
  labs(x = "Relative abundance", y = NULL) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 22) +
  theme(
    text = element_text(family = "Times"),
    axis.line.x = element_line(linewidth = 0.8, color = "black"),
    axis.line.y = element_line(linewidth = 0.8, color = "black"),
    axis.ticks.x = element_line(linewidth = 0.5, color = "black"),
    axis.ticks.y = element_line(linewidth = 0.5, color = "black"),
    panel.grid = element_blank(),
    axis.text.y = element_text(face = "italic", size = 18, family = "Times", color = "black"),
    axis.text.x = element_text(size = 18, family = "Times", color = "black"),
    axis.title.x = element_text(size = 20, face = "plain", family = "Times", color = "black"),
    legend.title = element_text(size = 12, face = "bold", family = "Times"),
    legend.text = element_text(size = 11, family = "Times"),
    legend.background = element_blank(),
    legend.key = element_blank(),
    plot.margin = margin(10, 10, 10, 10)
  )

print(p_bubble)

# Save
ggsave(path_target("FigS5a_bubble.pdf"), plot = p_bubble, width = 8.5, height = 6, dpi = 300)
ggsave(path_target("FigS5a_bubble.png"), plot = p_bubble, width = 8.5, height = 6, dpi = 300)
write_csv(df_sum, path_target("FigS5a_bubble_data.csv"))
write_csv(rare_vOTUs, path_target("FigS5a_rare_full.csv"))

message("‚úÖ Figure S5a completed!\n")

```

### Task 3: Figure S5b: Rare Viral Groups - Ecosystem Distribution
```{r}

message("========================================================================")

# ============================================================================
# STEP 1: Extract TPM and calculate relative abundance (per sample_group)
# ============================================================================
message("üìä Calculating relative abundance...")

# Extract TPM matrix from TSE
tpm_mat <- assays(tse)$tpm

# Create sample mapping using TSE colData
sample_df <- data.frame(
  sample_id = colnames(tse),
  sample_group = as.character(colData(tse)$sample_group),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)

# Convert to long format
abundance_long <- as.data.frame(tpm_mat) %>%

  pivot_longer(cols = -vOTU_id, names_to = "sample_id", values_to = "TPM") %>%
  dplyr::left_join(sample_df, by = "sample_id")

# Calculate total TPM per sample_group (all viruses)
sample_totals <- abundance_long %>%
  group_by(sample_group) %>%
  summarise(total_TPM = sum(TPM, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")

# Calculate relative abundance
abundance_rel <- abundance_long %>%
  dplyr::left_join(sample_totals, by = "sample_group") %>%
  mutate(rel_abundance = TPM / total_TPM)

# Identify RARE vOTUs (< 0.1% and > 0)
rare_votus_list <- abundance_rel %>%
  filter(rel_abundance < 0.001 & rel_abundance > 0) %>%
  pull(vOTU_id) %>%
  unique()

message(sprintf("‚úÖ Identified %d rare vOTUs (< 0.1%%)\n", length(rare_votus_list)))

# Filter rare vOTUs
abundance_rare <- abundance_rel %>%
  filter(vOTU_id %in% rare_votus_list)

# ============================================================================
# STEP 2: Extract ecosystem classification (from TSE metadata)
# ============================================================================
message("üåç Extracting ecosystem classification...")

# Function to extract Level5 (exactly as old code)
extract_level5_position5 <- function(eco_string) {
  if (is.na(eco_string) || eco_string == "") return(NA)
  parts <- strsplit(as.character(eco_string), ";")
  parts <- parts[[1]]
  parts <- trimws(parts)
  if (length(parts) >= 5 && parts[5] != "") {
    return(parts[5])
  } else {
    return(NA)
  }
}

# Extract Level5 from imgvr (now from TSE metadata)
imgvr_eco <- imgvr %>%
  select(contig_id, eco_class = `Ecosystem classification`) %>%
  mutate(level5 = sapply(eco_class, extract_level5_position5)) %>%
  filter(!is.na(level5)) %>%
  select(contig_id, level5) %>%
  distinct()

message("‚úÖ Ecosystem data extracted\n")


# ============================================================================
# STEP 3: Link ecosystem to vOTUs (using ALL contigs from metadata)
# ============================================================================
message("üîó Linking ecosystem classification (using ALL contigs)...")

# Use ALL contigs (from TSE metadata)
data_with_eco <- contig_anno %>%
  dplyr::left_join(imgvr_eco, by = "contig_id") %>%
  filter(!is.na(level5))

# Combine with abundance data (fix many-to-many warning)
abundance_rare_eco <- abundance_rare %>%
  filter(vOTU_id %in% data_with_eco$vOTU_id) %>%
  dplyr::left_join(
    data_with_eco %>% select(vOTU_id, level5) %>% distinct(), 
    by = "vOTU_id",
    relationship = "many-to-many"  # ‚Üê Ê∑ªÂä†Ëøô‰∏™Êù•Ê∂àÈô§warning
  )

message("‚úÖ Ecosystem data linked\n")

# ============================================================================
# STEP 4: Calculate relative abundance per ecosystem
# ============================================================================
message("üìä Calculating ecosystem abundance...")

# Ê≥®ÊÑèÔºöÊîπÊàê sample_group
abundance_by_eco_rare <- abundance_rare_eco %>%
  filter(!is.na(level5)) %>%
  group_by(sample_group, level5) %>%  # ‚Üê ÊîπÊàê sample_group
  summarise(
    level5_tpm = sum(TPM, na.rm = TRUE),
    n_viruses = n_distinct(vOTU_id),
    .groups = "drop"
  )

# Use total TPM of ALL viruses as denominator
abundance_by_eco_rare <- abundance_by_eco_rare %>%
  dplyr::left_join(sample_totals, by = "sample_group") %>%  # ‚Üê ÊîπÊàê sample_group Âíå sample_totals
  mutate(relative_abundance = level5_tpm / total_TPM) %>%  # ‚Üê ÊîπÊàê total_TPM
  select(sample_group, level5, level5_tpm, n_viruses, relative_abundance, total_TPM)

message(sprintf("‚úÖ Ecosystem data processed (%d rare vOTUs with ecosystem annotation)\n",
                length(unique(abundance_rare_eco$vOTU_id[!is.na(abundance_rare_eco$level5)]))))

# ============================================================================
# STEP 5: Define Level5 order and colors (exactly as old code)
# ============================================================================
level5_order <- c(
  "Host-associated(human)",
  "Host-associated(plants)",
  "Host-associated(other)",
  "Marine",
  "Freshwater",
  "Aquatic(sediment)",
  "Non-marine_Saline_and_Alkaline",

host_colors <- c("#F9E2C8", "#F4CCAC", "#C4714F")
water_colors <- c("#D4F0CD", "#B8E6AD", "#99DD87", "#2E7D32")
terrestrial_colors <- c("#D9C9BD", "#6D4C41")
special_colors <- c("#E8E4D8", "#5D4037")
all_colors <- c(host_colors, water_colors, terrestrial_colors, special_colors)
color_map <- setNames(all_colors, level5_order)

# ============================================================================
# STEP 6: Prepare plot data
# ============================================================================
plot_data <- abundance_by_eco_rare %>%
  mutate(sample_group = factor(sample_group, levels = c("BS", "SA", "IA", "DA"))) %>%  # ‚Üê ÊîπÊàê sample_group
```

### Figure S5c: Predicted Bacterial Host of Rare Viruses (Heatmap)

```{r}
#| label: figs5c-host-heatmap
#| message: true
#| fig.width: 8
#| fig.height: 10

message("========================================================================")
message("Figure S5c: Predicted Bacterial Host of Rare Viruses (Heatmap)")
message("Confidence threshold: ‚â•75")
message("========================================================================\n")

# ============================================================================
# STEP 1: Load host prediction data from TSE metadata
# ============================================================================
message("üì• Loading host prediction data from TSE metadata...")

# Ê≠£Á°ÆÁöÑ metadata keyÔºàÊúâ‰∏ãÂàíÁ∫øÔºâ
host_genome <- metadata(tse)$host_genome_edges  # ‚Üê Ê≥®ÊÑèÊòØ host_genome_edges

stopifnot(!is.null(host_genome))

message("‚úÖ host_genome loaded: ", nrow(host_genome), " predictions")
message("   Columns: ", paste(colnames(host_genome), collapse = ", "), "\n")


# ============================================================================
# STEP 2: Filter high-confidence host predictions (‚â•75)
# ============================================================================
CONFIDENCE_THRESHOLD <- 80

message(sprintf("üîç Filtering host predictions (confidence ‚â• %d)...\n", CONFIDENCE_THRESHOLD))

host_filtered <- host_genome %>%
  filter(Confidence.score >= CONFIDENCE_THRESHOLD) %>%
  mutate(
    Phylum = str_extract(Host.taxonomy, "(?<=p__)[^;]+"),
    Phylum = if_else(is.na(Phylum), "Unclassified", Phylum)
  )

message(sprintf("‚úÖ High-confidence predictions: %d rows", nrow(host_filtered)))
message(sprintf("‚úÖ Unique phyla: %d\n", n_distinct(host_filtered$Phylum)))

# ============================================================================
# STEP 3: Use rare vOTU list from Fig S5a/S5b (already calculated)
# ============================================================================
message("üìã Using rare vOTU list from previous analysis...")

# rare_votus_list should already exist from Fig S5a/S5b
# If not, recalculate (fallback)
if (!exists("rare_votus_list")) {
  message("‚ö†Ô∏è Recalculating rare vOTUs...")
  
  sample_map <- data.frame(
    sample_id = c("FCH3CGLCCXYL2DAA", "FCH3CGLCCXYL2EAA", "FCH3CGLCCXYL4FAA", "TARATASF"),
    sample_short = c("SA", "IA", "BS", "DA"),
    stringsAsFactors = FALSE
  )
  
  tpm_mat <- assays(tse)$tpm
  
  abundance_long <- as.data.frame(tpm_mat) %>%
    rownames_to_column("vOTU_id") %>%
    pivot_longer(cols = -vOTU_id, names_to = "sample_id", values_to = "TPM") %>%
    dplyr::left_join(sample_map, by = "sample_id")
  
  sample_total_tpm_all <- abundance_long %>%
    group_by(sample_short) %>%
    summarise(total_tpm_all = sum(TPM, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")
  
  abundance_rel <- abundance_long %>%
    dplyr::left_join(sample_total_tpm_all, by = "sample_short") %>%
    mutate(relative_abundance = TPM / total_tpm_all)
  
  rare_votus_list <- abundance_rel %>%
    filter(relative_abundance < 0.001 & relative_abundance > 0) %>%
    pull(vOTU_id) %>%
    unique()
}

message(sprintf("‚úÖ Rare vOTUs: %d\n", length(rare_votus_list)))

# ============================================================================
# STEP 4: Filter host predictions for rare vOTUs
# ============================================================================
message("üîó Filtering host predictions for rare vOTUs...")

host_rare <- host_filtered %>%
  filter(vOTU_id %in% rare_votus_list)

message(sprintf("‚úÖ Rare vOTUs with host predictions: %d\n", n_distinct(host_rare$vOTU_id)))

# ============================================================================
# STEP 5: Prepare abundance data for rare vOTUs
# ============================================================================
message("üìä Preparing abundance data...")

# Sample mapping (exactly as old code)
sample_map <- data.frame(
  sample_id = c("FCH3CGLCCXYL2DAA", "FCH3CGLCCXYL2EAA", "FCH3CGLCCXYL4FAA", "TARATASF"),
  sample_source1 = c("SA", "IA", "BS", "DA"),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)

# Extract TPM for rare vOTUs
tpm_mat <- assays(tse)$tpm

tpm_rare <- as.data.frame(tpm_mat) %>%
  rownames_to_column("vOTU_id") %>%
  filter(vOTU_id %in% rare_votus_list) %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = -vOTU_id, names_to = "sample_id", values_to = "tpm") %>%
  dplyr::left_join(sample_map, by = "sample_id") %>%
  filter(!is.na(sample_source1))

message("‚úÖ Abundance data prepared\n")

# ============================================================================
# STEP 6: Create heatmap data (presence/absence by Phylum)
# ============================================================================
message("üóÇÔ∏è Creating heatmap data...")

# Combine host predictions with abundance (many-to-many expected)
host_abundance <- host_rare %>%
  dplyr::left_join(tpm_rare, by = "vOTU_id", relationship = "many-to-many")

# Calculate presence/absence per sample and Phylum
heatmap_data <- host_abundance %>%
  filter(tpm > 0) %>%
  group_by(sample_source1, Phylum) %>%
  summarise(
    n_vOTUs = n_distinct(vOTU_id),
    presence = 1,
    .groups = "drop"
  )

# Complete the grid (all samples √ó all phyla)
all_samples <- c("BS", "SA", "IA", "DA")
all_phyla <- unique(host_filtered$Phylum)

heatmap_data_complete <- expand.grid(
  sample_source1 = all_samples,
  Phylum = all_phyla,
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
) %>%
  dplyr::left_join(heatmap_data, by = c("sample_source1", "Phylum")) %>%
  mutate(
    n_vOTUs = if_else(is.na(n_vOTUs), 0, as.numeric(n_vOTUs)),
    presence = if_else(is.na(presence), 0, presence)
  )

message(sprintf("‚úÖ Heatmap data ready: %d phyla detected\n", sum(heatmap_data_complete$presence > 0)))

# ============================================================================
# STEP 7: Create heatmap plot (exactly matching old code)
# ============================================================================
message("üé® Creating heatmap...")

# Set factor levels (exactly as old code)
heatmap_data_complete$sample_source1 <- factor(
  heatmap_data_complete$sample_source1, 
  levels = c("BS", "SA", "IA", "DA")
)

# Order phyla by total presence (exactly as old code)
phylum_order <- heatmap_data_complete %>%
  group_by(Phylum) %>%
  summarise(total_presence = sum(presence), .groups = "drop") %>%
  arrange(desc(total_presence)) %>%
  pull(Phylum)

heatmap_data_complete$Phylum <- factor(heatmap_data_complete$Phylum, levels = phylum_order)
```

```{r}
message("========================================================================")

# ============================================================================

# ============================================================================

host_genome <- metadata(tse)$host_genome_edges

stopifnot(!is.null(host_genome))

message("‚úÖ host_genome loaded: ", nrow(host_genome), " predictions")
message("   Columns: ", paste(colnames(host_genome), collapse = ", "), "\n")

# ============================================================================
# STEP 2: Filter high-confidence host predictions (‚â•75)
# ============================================================================
CONFIDENCE_THRESHOLD <- 80

message(sprintf("üîç Filtering host predictions (confidence ‚â• %d)...\n", CONFIDENCE_THRESHOLD))

host_filtered <- host_genome %>%
  filter(Confidence.score >= CONFIDENCE_THRESHOLD) %>%
  mutate(
    Phylum = str_extract(Host.taxonomy, "(?<=p__)[^;]+"),
    Phylum = if_else(is.na(Phylum), "Unclassified", Phylum)
  )

message(sprintf("‚úÖ High-confidence predictions: %d rows", nrow(host_filtered)))
message(sprintf("‚úÖ Unique phyla: %d\n", n_distinct(host_filtered$Phylum)))

# ============================================================================
message("üìä Calculating GLOBAL relative abundance...")

# Sample mapping (exactly as old code)

  sample_id = c("FCH3CGLCCXYL2DAA", "FCH3CGLCCXYL2EAA", "FCH3CGLCCXYL4FAA", "TARATASF"),
  sample_source1 = c("SA", "IA", "BS", "DA"),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)

# Extract TPM
tpm_mat <- assays(tse)$tpm

# Convert to long format
abundance_long <- as.data.frame(tpm_mat) %>%
  rownames_to_column("vOTU_id") %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = -vOTU_id, names_to = "sample_id", values_to = "TPM") %>%
  dplyr::left_join(sample_map, by = "sample_id")

# *** GLOBAL DEFINITION: Calculate TOTAL TPM across ALL samples ***
total_TPM_global <- sum(abundance_long$TPM, na.rm = TRUE)

message(sprintf("‚úÖ Total TPM (GLOBAL): %.2f\n", total_TPM_global))

abundance_per_group <- abundance_long %>%
  group_by(sample_source1, vOTU_id) %>%
  summarise(TPM_sum = sum(TPM, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = "drop")

# *** Calculate GLOBAL relative abundance ***
abundance_per_group <- abundance_per_group %>%
  mutate(rel_abundance_global = TPM_sum / total_TPM_global)

# Identify RARE vOTUs (< 0.1% GLOBALLY and > 0)
rare_votus_list_global <- abundance_per_group %>%
  filter(rel_abundance_global < 0.001 & rel_abundance_global > 0) %>%
  pull(vOTU_id) %>%
  unique()

message(sprintf("‚úÖ Identified %d rare vOTUs (< 0.1%% GLOBALLY)\n", length(rare_votus_list_global)))
```
